main event: On September 3, 1956, a civilian in Bert, Michigan, reported a ground-visual observation of one oblong bright red object drifting north at 12,000 feet, which faded from sight after being observed for six minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as oblong and bright red, with no visible arms or other features.
It was observed drifting north at 12,000 feet and then faded from sight after a six-minute observation period.
The report suggests that the shape, color, and manner of disappearance indicate that the sighting was likely caused by an aircraft.
The weather was clear at the time of the sighting, and there were winds aloft at 12,009 feet.
There was no unusual activity reported, and no interception or action was taken.
